detaileddescription.para:
update the disjoint set and the connected forest so that include all the old keys and the newly inserted key
this method won't change the node value

memberdef.definition: bool ControlPlaneOthello< K, V, L, DL, maintainDP, maintainDisjointSet, randomized >::testHash
memberdef.name: testHash

detaileddescription.para: test if this hash pair is acyclic, and build: the connected forest and the disjoint set of connected relation the disjoint set will be only useful to determine the root of a connected component
Assume: all build related memory are cleared before Side effect: the disjoint set and the connected forest are changed

memberdef.definition: void ControlPlaneOthello< K, V, L, DL, maintainDP, maintainDisjointSet, randomized >::fillTreeDFS
memberdef.name: fillTreeDFS

detaileddescription.para:
Fill the values of a connected tree starting at the root node and avoid searching keyId Assume:
the value of root is properly set before the function call
the values are in the value array
the root is always from array A Side effect: all node in this tree is set and if updateToFilled

x

memberdef.definition: int64_t ControlPlaneOthello< K, V, L, DL, maintainDP, maintainDisjointSet, randomized >::fixHalfTreeDFS
memberdef.name: fixHalfTreeDFS

detaileddescription.para:
Fix the values of a connected tree starting at the root node and avoid searching keyId Assume:
the value of root is not properly set before the function call
the values are in the value array
the root is always from array A Side effect: all node in this tree is set and if updateToFilled
the xor template: > 0 starting from the A node < 0 from the B node == 0 doesn't matter

memberdef.definition: bool ControlPlaneOthello< K, V, L, DL, maintainDP, maintainDisjointSet, randomized >::build
memberdef.name: build

detaileddescription.para: try really hard to build, until success or tryCount >= MAX_REHASH
Side effect: 1) discard all memory except keys and values. 2) build fail, or all the values and disjoint set are properly set

memberdef.definition: uint64_t ControlPlaneOthello< K, V, L, DL, maintainDP, maintainDisjointSet, randomized >::getMemoryCost
memberdef.name: getMemoryCost

detaileddescription.para: Control plane Othello can track connections (Add [amortized], Delete, Membership Judgment) in O(1) time, and can iterate on the keys in exactly n elements.
Implementation: just add an array indMem to be maintained. always ensure that registered keys can be queried to get the index of it in the keys array
How to ensure: add to tail when add, and store the value as well as the index to othello when delete, move key-value and update corresponding index

The valueType must be compatible with all int operations
If you wish to export the control plane to a data plane query structure at a fast speed and at any time, then set willExport to true. Additional computation and memory overheads will apply on insert, while lookups will be faster.
If you wish to maintain the disjoint set, the insertion will become faster but the deletion is slower, in the sense that memory accesses are more expensive than computation
